DOC.brief_summary: Progesterone levels measured in blood/serum of patients on the day of ovulation induction following controlled ovarian stimulation for in vitro fertilization may be associated with pregnancy outcome. The hypothesis is that higher progesterone levels are associated with lower implantation rates due to changes in the endometrial receptivity.
DOC.brief_title: Progesterone on the Day of Ovulation Induction is Associated With Pregnancy Outcome
DOC.criteria: IVF/ICSI following controlled ovarian stimulation progesterone measured on the day of ovulation induction informed consent missing consent
